summary: This is an email chain from October 29, 2019, regarding the Epstein investigation. An FBI Special Agent requests access to a subpoena log and records posted on the USAO's FTP site (USAFX), following up on an earlier email from an Assistant United States Attorney who had provided the log and access instructions in August 2019.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Violent Crimes Task Force
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent is requesting access to the USAFX site to view subpoenas and returns for the Epstein investigation, noting they are reviewing emails to ensure everything is in the case file.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The AUSA previously sent an email with an attached subpoena log and information about accessing subpoenas and returns on the USAFX site, offering help with account setup.

persons.name: Wil
persons.context: Mentioned by the AUSA as someone who can help others get an account for the USAFX site, requiring a cellphone number.

connections.person1: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Violent Crimes Task Force
connections.description: The FBI Special Agent is communicating with the AUSA to obtain access to subpoena records for the Epstein investigation, indicating a working relationship on the case.
The AUSA references Wil as a point of contact for helping others get accounts for the USAFX site, suggesting a professional association.

events.title: Subpoena Log and Records Distribution
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email with an attached log of all subpoenas and informs recipients that the actual subpoenas and returns are posted on the USAO's FTP site (USAFX).

events.title: FBI Agent Requests Access to Subpoena Records
events.description: An FBI Special Agent follows up on the earlier email, requesting access to the USAFX site to ensure all subpoena records are in the Epstein case file.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Violent Crimes Task Force

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing investigative activity in the Epstein case as of October 2019, with law enforcement actively compiling subpoena records.
Subpoena records and returns were being managed and shared via a secure FTP site (USAFX) operated by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
An FBI Special Agent was conducting a review to ensure all subpoena-related materials were properly included in the Epstein case file.
The email chain indicates coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office in the Southern District of New York regarding evidence collection.
